original: Exhibit 10.7 CONTENT LICENSE AGREEMENT This Content License Agreement (this “Agreement”) is dated as of October 1, 2005 (the “Effective Date”) and is by and between Emdeon Corporation a Delaware corporation (“Emdeon”), with offices at at 669 River Drive, Center 2, Elmwood Park, New Jersey 07407 and WebMD, Inc. a Georgia Corporation (“WebMD”), with offices at 111 Eighth Avenue, New York, NY 10011. ollama_generated:
Exhibit 10.7 REVERSED CONTENT LICENSE AGREEMENT

This Reversed Content License Agreement (this "Agreement"), effective as of October 1, 2005, is entered into between WebMD, Inc., a Georgia Corporation, with offices at 111 Eighth Avenue, New York, NY 10011 ("WebMD"), and Emdeon Corporation, a Delaware corporation, with offices at 669 River Drive, Center 2, Elmwood Park, New Jersey 07407 ("Emdeon"). For the avoidance of doubt, this Agreement is based on the terms and conditions set forth herein and any attached hereto shall not apply unless explicitly agreed upon in writing by both parties.

In this Agreement, WebMD grants Emdeon a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free, revocable, and non-transferable license to use, reproduce, distribute, display, and create derivative works of the Content (as defined below) for any purpose, subject to Emdeon's obligation to promptly remove the Content upon written request from WebMD. The term "Content" shall mean all data, information, materials, or other content provided by WebMD to Emdeon under this Agreement.

Upon receipt of the Content, Emdeon agrees to indemnify and hold harmless WebMD, its officers, directors, employees, agents, and affiliates from any and all claims, damages, liabilities, losses, expenses, or costs (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or resulting from Emdeon's use, reproduction, distribution, display, or creation of derivative works of the Content.

Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, WebMD shall have the right to terminate this Agreement at any time by providing written notice to Emdeon. Upon such termination, Emdeon shall immediately cease using, reproducing, distributing, displaying, or creating derivative works of the Content and return all copies thereof to WebMD, if requested.

This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties concerning the subject matter herein and supersedes any prior or contemporaneous agreements or understandings, whether written or oral. Any amendment or modification to this Agreement must be in writing and signed by both parties. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Georgia without regard to its conflict of laws principles. The parties agree that any legal action arising out of or related to this Agreement shall be brought exclusively in a court of competent jurisdiction located in Fulton County, Georgia, and the parties consent to the personal jurisdiction and venue therein for such purposes.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Reversed Content License Agreement as of the Effective Date.

------------------------------- -------------------------------
WebMD, Inc.                     Emdeon Corporation

modified:
Title: Modification of Contractual Obligation Regarding Service Delivery

Original Clause: The Service Provider shall deliver the Services in a timely manner, in accordance with industry standards and all applicable laws. Any failure to comply with this provision will be considered as a material breach of contract by the Service Provider.

Rewritten Clause: While every effort will be made by the Client to ensure the prompt receipt of all necessary information and resources required for the Service Provider to deliver the Services, the Service Provider acknowledges that any delays in service delivery may arise from factors beyond its control. In such instances, the Service Provider shall endeavor to complete the Services as soon as reasonably practicable, but delay will not constitute a material breach of contract by the Service Provider.

original: The entire set of Anatomical Line Drawings. Anatomical Line Drawings are printable line drawings intended for physicians to draw on and illustrate diseases and conditions to patients.

It is not the responsibility of the provider to ensure the accuracy or completeness of any annotations made by the physician using these drawings.

6. Limited Disclosure Obligation:

In the course of this Agreement, each Party may disclose to the other certain Confidential Information for the purposes of fulfilling their respective obligations under this Agreement. Each Receiving Party shall take reasonable measures to protect and safeguard such Confidential Information from unauthorized use or disclosure. However, a Receiving Party shall not be liable for any unauthorized use or disclosure caused by circumstances beyond its control, including but not limited to, compulsory legal process or governmental order.

original: 7. Assignment . Neither party shall have the right to sell, assign, transfer or hypothecate (all hereinafter referred to as “assign” or “assignment”) this Agreement, or delegate any of its obligations hereunder, voluntarily or by operation of law, without the prior written consent of the other party.
ollama_generated:
7. Assignment . Each party retains the right, with the prior written consent of the other party, to sell, assign, transfer, or hypothecate (all hereinafter referred to as "assign" or "assignment") this Agreement, or delegate any of its obligations hereunder, voluntarily or by operation of law. The granting of such consent shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed.

This revised clause now grants both parties the right to assign or transfer the agreement with each other's prior written consent, as opposed to the original clause which prohibited such actions without the other party's consent. Additionally, it has been softened by stating that the granting of consent "shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed," suggesting a more lenient approach in practice compared to the original text.

This agreement does not imply the establishment of any formal relationship such as a partnership, joint venture, or agency between WebMD and Emdeon. In this manner, the original clause has been rewritten to shift some of the responsibilities from Emdeon to WebMD regarding third-party agreements.
